title: How to Install a Gas Line

steps.headline: Buy the right gas pipes and  fittings for the job.
steps.description: Most domestic gas lines use 1/2-inch (1.27 cm) through 1 1/2 inch (3.81 cm) black pipe, while large commercial projects sometimes use larger fittings up to 8 inch. from 1/2" to 1 1/2"pipe the face of a fitting to face of another fitting you add 3/4".

steps.headline: Turn off the gas to your house.
steps.description: The valve will be at your gas meter on the side of your house and should shut off entirely with a quarter-turn. A position perpendicular to the pipe indicates a closed valve, but you should double-check by confirming that the meter is no longer moving when a appliance is using gas.

steps.headline: Extend your existing gas line by fitting the valves and pipe lengths you need to add a gas line that will reach your new appliance.
steps.description: Coat the threads of the pipe ends using pipe dope. This is essential to establishing an airtight fit. Never use tape, including Teflon tape; it can come loose inside the pipe and can clog the line. You can make your job easier by assembling some lengths of your gas line in your garage or shop, then moving them to the crawl space or wall where your gas lines run. Be wary of 90-degree bends if you do this; it makes turning the pipe to tighten it more difficult.

steps.headline: Use a flexible pipe to connect the end of your new gas line to the appliance.
steps.description: (This is not required unless in earthquake prone area/zone.) Follow instructions supplied with flex connectors.

steps.headline: Test your line is airtight.
steps.description: Spread a mixture of 1:1 water and dish liquid over each seam in your gas line. If bubbles appear, you have a leak. Try tightening the joint some more until you can not tighten anymore. If still leaks, undo, check threads, and reapply pipe dope and tighten again. If the leak still appears, change the pipe and fitting.

steps.headline: Turn the gas back on by returning the valve to parallel to the incoming pipe.
steps.description: Test your appliance to ensure the gas is flowing properly.
